newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: YACHTING - Build-up regattas for America's Cup.
newsitem.headline: YACHTING - Build-up regattas for America's Cup.

text.p: AUCKLAND, Jan 13 - Team New Zealand will stage a series of international regattas in the lead-up to their defence of the America's Cup in 2000, team leader Sir Peter Blake said on Monday.
The first series, in the two identical Team New Zealand yachts which were built for New Zealand's 1992 challenge in San Diego, will begin in Wellington in March.
Team New Zealand, under skipper Russell Coutts, will race against the New York Yacht Club in the "Road to America's Cup" regatta.
The two yachts have been refurbished, with one painted and liveried in the same manner as the victorious Black Magic, while the other is painted white.
After racing in the capital, the yachts will be transported to Auckland where three as-yet-unnamed syndicates will race in April.
Blake said the New York Yacht Club, as the challenger of record for 2000, were automatic invitees.
The international regattas would take place over three summers leading up to 2000.
